data.title: Needs some work
data.text: We stopped in for snacks and drinks.  Firstly, we got a waiter who was brand new.  We ordered drinks- he had no idea what some were or if they had the stuff to make the drinks- someone should have shadowed this poor young man.  It wasn't his fault, it was his lack of proper training before he was cut loose.  They had limited options, we thought,  for appetizers so we ordered light options-I got a grilled cheese. When the young man brought out drinks, he did so with his fingers on the rim of the glass where you would normally drink- a no no which training should have taken care of .  Then when delivered, my fries were delicious, but my grilled cheese was cold- a little timing issue there.  When it came time to pay, we waited and waited ...come to find out our server was not allowed to use the cash register and was waiting for someone else to close us out.  We felt so bad for the young man that we did not complain, but the manager/owner or someone needs to work on this.  Train your servers, please, BEFORE we come to visit!

data.title: Mr.
data.text: Very good food. Excellent beer selection. In house brewery plus local beer selections. Will definitely come back. Great service. Friendly staff.

data.title: Best of the Best in Abilene
data.text: From the lunch special to a quant dinner for two. This an excellent choice for any budget. They even brew their own beers right there in the restaurant.

data.title: Amazing Atmosphere - Delicious Burger
data.text: While in downtown Abilene, Cypress Street is the perfect lunch or dinner restaurant. The Wasabi Mushroom Burger with a cold Cucumber/Avacado/Lime soup was the best combination on a hot West Texas summer afternoon. The service was excellent coupled with the ambience of the  historic building made for a relaxing lunch! I'll be back!

data.title: Mother's Day Lunch
data.text: I like this place. The atmosphere is very nice , our waiter was very attentive, the food was delicious, and they make their own beer. My Mother had the "Down South Burger" which was the special of the day. My lovely Wife had the "CBLT" and I had the "Fish and Chips'. The CBLT is a BLT but adds Canadian Bacon and that is one of her favorites. The fish I had was Cod and the chips (fries) that came with it were AMAZINGLY good. Both of their plates came with actual chips that are made in house. The only thing I was surprised at was that the fish were at least half the size than any other place I have ever ordered this combo from. The Cypress is located in the historic district of Abilene's downtown. They also have a bar separated by a partition that seemed nice.

data.title: An Excellent Lunch!
data.text: My wife and I ate lunch there on Friday, 13 May 2016.  I had the Smokehouse Linguine and she had the Veracruz Chicken Ciabatta.  Both were very flavorful and well-presented.  Portions were ample for lunch.

data.title: A nice option for lunch
data.text: We came here looking for a quick lunch downtown. The salad I had and the sandwich my wife had were adequate, though not memorable. It's convenient for a meal if you are coming to Frontier Texas,  a multimedia museum about the old west.

data.title: Average
data.text: Everyone was very nice but their local brews weren't my favorite and the food was bland and average. The building was really nice but it seems it's best days are behind it.

data.title: Average at best
data.text: I had heard GREAT things about this restaurant so when my family was here for homecoming we went here. The prices were a little high but we we're expecting that. Most of us got the "brick oven" pizza and were thoroughly disappointed. It came out on a cardboard circle like the ones that come frozen. It also tastes that way. After some reviews had raved about the pizza we we're excited to try it. It wasn't any better than pizza hut and more expensive. Such a shame:( we haven't been back since. Its a lovely restaurant, awesome location, beautifully decorated  but the food was sub par as was the service. It wasn't busy at all and we waited close to 45-50 minutes for our food and we weren't complicated. It did come out hot though so props to that.

data.title: I don't regret it, but won't return
data.text: Was recommended to us as "upscale" by a lady at the nearby museum. This is false, unless you consider Chili's as fine dining. The food was ok. Certainly not bad, but nothing to get excited over. The waitress was mostly absent, but incredibly friendly when we saw her, which earns points. If you are downtown and looking for a quick bite in walking distance, go for it, but don't make a special trip for it.

data.title: Great food in Downtown
data.text: I love this restaurant!  I've had several different entrées and loved them all.  They even give burgers a new flavor,  and I can't stop eating their hand made potato chips.  Friendly attentive staff polishes this place off for an excellent dining experience

data.title: Monthly Meeting
data.text: Average service - group setting with reservations and they only assigned one waiter!  Very overpriced for quantity and quality of meal.  Cannot recommend.

data.title: Downtown Dining
data.text:
Cypress Street Station has it all. Excellent food, great service as well as one of the areas only breweries .  Lunch specials are all prepared fresh daily as well as the dinner items. If you are looking for a great meal and service, make Cypress Street Station one of you planned stops win visiting the city.
5 Star all the way.....

data.title: Good Place For Lunch
data.text:
Four of us had lunch here and it was good food and good service, but neither were exceptional.  The atmosphere is nice and is basically a micro brewery with a dining area attached.  It was very comfortable and quite nice.

We were seated immediately and our server, while not extraordinary, did do a good job and took good care of us.

If you are in downtown Abilene, then I do recommend you eat here, but for this type of restaurant and atmosphere, I have to say it was average.

data.title: good place
data.text: upscale restaurant with their own brewery.  A good date night place to go. Piano Man plays there. Food and service is A+.

data.title: So close
data.text: Menu is a bit thin on offerings. Dinner was good but nothing to brag about. Uninspired. Service was good but again not more than adequate.

data.title: Good Food, Questionable beer.....
data.text: The food and the service were quite good.  Their beer (Cypress Station's own) is quite questionable.  I later found out that the brewmeister there uses malt extracts (canned) - which would account for it tasting similar to my early attempts in college to make my own beer.  All that being said - there are plenty of other beer choices on the menu, and, the food made it all worthwhile.

data.title: OK for future visits.
data.text: Nice casual dining. Attentive wait staff. Good lunch menu. Extremely tasty Fish and chips. Will be going back after New Years Eve.

data.title: Mediocre food & service
data.text: There are better places to eat than Cypress Street.  Out-dated menu with poor service.  The restaurant needs a major over-haul.

data.title: Sarcastic Employees
data.text: My husband and I took our friends from Oregon for some drinks after a wedding at The Grace. We asked the hostess if it they were still open (it was about 10:15pm) and she said yes but kitchen was closed. We sat at the bar and noticed we were the only ones there. My friend wanted a shot of Fireball and the bartender sarcastically said "we are not that fancy!" and semi rolled his eyes as he walked away. Wow! how is that appropriate?!  When we finally got our drinks, we heard that bartender and a couple of other workers sighing/yawning and coughing very noticeably and fake-y in order for us to close out and for them to close/leave. Needless to say, I was personally embarrassed and regretted to have even taken my friends there. Very nasty attitudes and mediocre drinks. I will never recommend this place to anyone! I've been twice before for dinner and let's just say it is overpriced and has an extremely limited selection. This is place is clearly struggling.
